name: imageDrawArc
syntax: imageDrawArc(name, x, y, width, height, startAngle, archAngle [, filled])
member: someImage.drawArc(x, y, width, height, startAngle, archAngle [, filled])
description: Draws a circular or elliptical arc.

params.name: name
params.description: The image on which this operation is performed.

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate of the upper-left corner of the arc.

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the arc.

params.name: archAngle
params.description: The angular extent of the arc, relative to the start angle.

params.name: filled
params.description: Specify whether the arc is filled

examples.title: Tag Syntax
examples.description: This example shows how to use the imageNew function to create a blank ColdFusion image that is 250 pixels wide and 180 pixels high.
examples.code:
<cfset myImage=imageNew("",250,320)> 
 <!--- Set the drawing color for the arc to orange. --->  
 <cfset imageSetDrawingColor(myImage,"orange")> 
 <!--- Turn on antialiasing to improve image quality. --->  
 <cfset imageSetAntialiasing(myImage,"on")> 
 <!--- Draw an enclosed orange arc starting at the coordinate (5,5). --->  
 <cfset imageDrawArc(myImage,5,5,200,300,100,100,"yes")> 
 <!--- Display the image in a browser. --->  
 <cfimage action="writeToBrowser" source="#myImage#">

examples.title: Using drawArc member function
examples.description: CF11+ Lucee4.5+ Draw a circle in the center of the image and fill with color
